meanings.definition: The act of loading or putting something onto a vehicle or vessel.
meanings.sent1: The onloading of boxes onto the truck was done carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: The onloading of passengers onto the cruise ship began early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The onloading of the clown car with oversized props made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The onloading of responsibilities onto his shoulders felt like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The onloading of groceries into the car was like solving a puzzle to fit everything in.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring data or information onto a computer or device.
meanings.sent1: The onloading of photos from the camera to the computer was quick and easy.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the onloading of the software is complete before using the new program.
meanings.sent3: The onloading of music onto the phone made it a portable jukebox.
meanings.sent4: The onloading of knowledge into young minds is a crucial part of education.
meanings.sent5: The onloading of updates onto the device improved its performance significantly.
